content.description: Up the face. The hard part is the first 10 feet off the ground - (could try starting close to the Margie's Curves crack, or farther away right). Above that sustained 5.9 - (though difficulty not as sustained as Retro Vertigo next to it).
content.protection: Tricky to set up for Top-Rope. No bolts at top or along the way.
content.location: On the face just right of Margie's Curves Right .

content.description: Climb a bouldery right facing flake to a bolt and a rest.  Delicately climb the face above past 2 more bolts to a horizontal.  Clip a 4th bolt and pull the small roof using nice finger pockets. Finish on the fun face past a 5th bolt to a 2 ring anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 ring anchors at the top.
content.location: 10 feet right of Curt's Crack

content.description: Climb the crimpy delicate face to the right of "Snap Crackle Plop"
content.protection: This route can be toproped from the anchors of "Snap Crackle Plop"
content.location: 5 feet to the right of "Snap Crackle Plop"

content.description: Roughly straight up the face with many thoughtful moves. Difficulty more sustained than Vertigo next to it.
content.protection: Tricky to set up for Top-Rope. One bolt at top with no hanger on it.   (? Not remembering if there are any bolts along the way on the route -- see below under Comments ?)
content.location:
On the middle of the face between Margie's Curves Right and 

Birthday Girl .

content.description: First splitter crack on the Main Wall. Climb the crack straight to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack + a #4 size or two
content.location: 20ft right of Moby Neil

climbs.name: Please Don't Pop
climbs.fa: R. Lukas TR, J. Forte Lead

content.description: Start on a shallow, red, right facing flake.  Climb past 5 bolts to a 2 ring anchor.  Crux is at the roof.  Try to find the fun no-handed rest, mid face!
content.protection: 5 bolts
content.location: Follow the line of 5 bolts, 10 feet left of "The Apprentice"

content.description: A near vertical face with some fun crimps and pinches. Climb the thin face straight up.
content.protection: Top rope setup.
content.location: It is 5 feet left of Curt's Crack.

content.description: Start at the flake, move up through some jugs to a ledge (5.4), then into an left facing dihedral/corner to the top.
content.protection: Usually top roped.
content.location: Far left of the Main Wall.

content.description: Climb the same crack as Margies Curves Left however at the split (bottom of the Tombstone) follow the crack right.
content.protection: Standard rack
content.location: 30-40 +/- ft right of Pebbles.

content.description: Fine, fun crack. Third splitter on the Main Wall.Above the horizontal at 35 feet, you can finish up the offwidth (5.6) or climb the face to the right of the crack past 2 bolts to reach a 2 ring anchor at 50 feet.Well protected with plenty of options for feet outside the crack as well.
content.protection: Standard rack + optional #4
content.location: 30 +/- feet right of Pebbles.

content.description: Nice introduction to Boxcar.    Up the obvious crack. Interesting crux sequence mid-way. Fun moves below and above.
content.protection: No bolts at top or along the way. Trad gear for the crack.   Top-Rope straightforward to set up with long slings.
content.location: The obvious bottom-to-top crack at the far right (east) end of the wall. Just left of a narrow gully rising gently up right-ward.

content.description: Climb up the Margies Curves crack but instead of following the crack left or right, go straight up onto the face and to the top.
content.protection: Top roped usually. Two bolts as top anchors.
content.location: 30-40 +/- ft right of Pebbles

content.description: Crimpy, exciting face climbing
content.protection: 2 bolts and trad gear
content.location: Look for 2 bolts on the wall to the right of Russell's Ruin

content.description: A very featured climb which is very different from the straight forward face climbing on most of the wall. The start can be made harder if you go straight up but can be maneuvered along the shelves for an even easier start. The crux is getting on the roof box as it is for most climbs here, it still is not as hard as most and is very consistent throughout the climb. Climb into the cave from the opposite side to say hello to any fellow hikers on the opposite side of the wall! Also when belaying there’s a good standing place 20ft from the wall and this lowers the rope drag considerably.
content.protection: Anchors with Rap Rings
content.location: After moving to the back of the main wall, look for the boulder hanging out the wall 30 ft up and the anchors are directly above it. This climb is also directly under a cave that can be accessed from the front of the main wall. Set the top rope by scrambling up the front of the main wall.

content.description: Toprope this route using the anchors of "Please Don't Pop"
content.protection: Toprope only
content.location: This route is to the left of "Please don't pop"

content.description:
Classic (for the area) splitter that goes from fingers, to thin hands, to hands then is fist and/or offwidth(y) above the horizontal. 

  You can climb the fingers to hands crack to the horizontal then instead of continuing onto the fist/offwidth above, crawl (an average size human can fit) through the passage/tunnel and build an anchor. Just an option.
content.protection: standard rack + optional #4 cam for above the horizontal
content.location: Second full length splitter on the main wall.

content.description: Climb the thin crimpy face straight up to the top.
content.protection: Top roped. Two bolts as top anchors.
content.location: A couple feet right of Russell's Ruin.

content.description:
Fun face climb through 2 bolts. Start in the left facing corner, move up to the horizontal and diagonal left to the first bolt; straight up from there.  Hunt for the amazing finger tube above the small roof. 

  Two bolts for a top anchor. 

  This is the easiest bolted/mixed route here.
content.protection: 2 bolts plus a horizontal that takes a piece of pro.
content.location: Far right of the Main Wall proper. +/-20 ft right of Margies Curves - Left.

content.description: Crimpy and requires some solid footwork.
content.protection: 3 bolts + a cam placement or two
content.location: Just right of The Apprentice and +/- 15ft left of Margies Curves - Left

content.description: Classic bolted line. Crimpy with a few, various, small features to use on the way up.
content.protection: 5 bolts to the top.
content.location: Left of Autumns Child. Bolts are just left of a left leaning, right facing, small corner.

content.description:
The largest and most accessible wall at Boxcar Rocks. Climbs are on the south facing (sunny) side of the wall. The routes run around 45-50 feet tall. 

  Most or all of the Main Wall now has bolts for anchors just below the top of the wall. In the past they were directly on the top, and subject to much vandalism.  These bolts can be reached most safely by lead climbing an easier route.  

  Alternately you can scramble up blocks on the back/north side of the wall. You'll still have to free climb easy class 5 rock to reach the top and set anchors from the back. We sent our anchor setter up wearing his climbing shoes, let him clip in to an anchor bolt for safety, then let him haul up the heavy gear and rope on a cord.  

  Routes from left to right: 

  Just right of the Turtle Head: 

 Moby Neil 5.6 G Locomotive Breath 5.10c TR Moby Direct 5.7 TR Russel's Ruin 5.5 G Cobblestoned 5.11d TR Bam Bam 5.10a TR: the wall immediately left of Pebbles crack. I think I noticed some bolts there. Pebbles 5.6 G: the almost-vertical crack. It goes up 3/4ths of the way up the wall, shifts slightly right at the horizontal, then resumes verticality to the top. Curt's Crack 5.7 G Snap Crackle Plop 5.10a (bolts) The Apprentice 5.9 (5 bolts) Autumn's Child 5.10a G

  Margie's curves: look for the only Y-shaped crack on the main wall. The area between the arms of the Y is the Headstone. 

 Margie's Curves Left 5.7 G Headstone TR 5.9 Margie's Curves Right rating? Vertigo 5.9 R Retro Vertigo 5.10a R Birthday Girl 5.7 G (2 bolts) Kinesiology 5.6 G

  This list covers most but not all climbs we saw there in winter 2012. More face lines are bolted now than I have listed here. The obvious crack climbs are all named in this list, and graded 5.5 to 5.7 G. The farthest left crack was wider than others, and 4" or wider SLCDs might work best there. Most others look doable with standard 3" and smaller gear, unless we missed some surprises higher up.
